trigger: Lipopolysaccharide induces phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> MAD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and activation of <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and related NF-kappa B proteins in human monocytic THP-1 cells .

Many effects of lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) on gene expression , including that of human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) , in monocytic cells are mediated by activation of kappa B DNA - binding proteins .

However , the specific members of the NF-kappa B / Rel transcription factor family involved in the LPS response , and the mechanisms through which LPS - generated signals are transduced remain unclear .

Here we show that LPS induces nuclear expression of <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> heterodimers as well as <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( NF-kappa B ) kappa B DNA - binding complexes in human monocytic THP-1 cells .

Nuclear localization of these proteins occurred concomitantly with a rapid decrease in their cytosolic levels and was independent of phorbol ester - sensitive protein kinase C . Within 24 h following LPS stimulation there was a striking increase in the levels of <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p105 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the cytosol .
The increased levels of these proteins correlated with increases in the amounts of their mRNAs during LPS activation of THP-1 cells .

LPS activation of THP-1 cells resulted in phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> MAD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( an I kappa B-like protein ) , a rapid increase in <extra_id_0> MAD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA , and an increase in <extra_id_0> MAD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein by 2 h . Thus , LPS activation of human monocytic cells results in nuclear expression of <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( NF-kappa B ) and induces phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> MAD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
